Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:87-3
Struct Forbidden Variables: When creating a struct, it is possible to use certain built-in variables as member variable names, for example:

Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:88-3
Struct Forbidden Variables:
{ANY_CODE} mystruct = {
object_index : obj_Player,
speed : 3,
image_blend : c_red
}

Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:90-3
Struct Forbidden Variables: However, only local and instance scope built-in variables can be used this way and assigned values as if they were regular struct member variables. Using global scope built-in variables is forbidden and will cause issues with your game. Below you can find a full list of these variables so that you know which ones to avoid.

Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:92-3
Struct Forbidden Variables: The following built-in global variables are all available for use in your projects but cannot be used as struct member variables:

Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:172-3
Struct Forbidden Variables: Apart from those global variables, there are also a number of obsolete built-in global variables that are unavailable due to the possibility of them being included in imported legacy products (GameMaker Studio 2 needs to reserve these variables so it can recognise them on import and flag them to be updated/removed):

Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.head: Struct_Forbidden_Variables.htm+html.body.p:241-1
Struct Forbidden Variables: {SEARCH_RESULT} This page lists all the built-in global variables that cannot be used as member variable names for structs
